Articles.Content: Hi I was wondering by what amount I have to reduce the density of the EVA Propellant resource on kerbals in order to reduce the delta v available by say a factor of 10. This is all since the thruster isp seems to be hard coded. I just wondered if there is a quick/simple calculation that would give a good estimate. Thanks!

I don't know if the mass of a Kerbal in EVA changes as jetpack fuel is consumed.

If yes, then you'll have to use the rocket equation.

If no, then take 1/10 of the total fuel to reduce the dV by a factor of 10.

I don't know if the mass of a Kerbal in EVA changes as jetpack fuel is consumed.

If yes, then you'll have to use the rocket equation.

If no, then take 1/10 of the total fuel to reduce the dV by a factor of 10.

It does not. Also the Kerbals are massless entirely when in the command pod.

Hmmm strange I tried setting the density to 0.000001251 and I still get a crap ton of DeltaV. Hope squad take note and open that up as well to modders. :/

- - - Updated - - -

It does not. Also the Kerbals are massless entirely when in the command pod.

Not with mods
Would it be possible to change the max EVA propellant to 0.5?
